column4: This bonus card's condition is ``Birds that eat [rodent]'', not ``Birds that only eat [rodent]'', and its clarification text is, ``Any bird with a [rodent] symbol. The bird may also eat other kinds of food." (These misprints were corrected in the third printing, and a corrected card is available in the update pack.)
When using this bird's power to move this bird to another habitat, the action cube does not change habitats with it.
When using this bird's power to move this bird to another habitat, the action cube does not change habitats with it.

The percentage on this bonus card should be 16\%. (This misprint was corrected in print by February 2020.)
The word \textit{prairie} is a keyword for the \textbf{Cartographer} bonus card. (This omission was corrected in print by December 2019.)

The only keywords that qualify a bird to count toward this bonus card are those listed thereon, including \textit{prairie} (which is printed on this bonus card only in newer printings), and those in the relevant sections of the expansion rulebooks.
This bird counts toward the \textbf{Cartographer} bonus card. (In early printings that bonus card did list include the keyword \textit{prairie}.)
The 3-point bonus applies when there are 4--5 qualifying birds on your player mat, not 2--3. (This misprint was corrected in the third printing, and a corrected card is available in the update pack.)
This bird is worth 5 points, not 4. (This misprint was corrected in the third printing, and a corrected card is available in the update pack.)
Regular reroll rules apply whenever you have the opportunity to gain food from the birdfeeder.

Only powers of birds played on a player mat can be used. In particular, birds with the power ``This bird counts double toward the end-of-round goal, if it qualifies for the goal." (e.g., \textbf{Cetti’s Warbler}) does not count double toward the \textbf{[card] in hand} end-of-round goal.
If a bird (e.g., \textbf{Common Buzzard}) is played on top of this one, the top bird is also placed horizontally and occupies both columns.
If this bird is played on top of a horizontal one (e.g., \textbf{Common Blackbird}), it is also placed horizontally and occupies both columns.
If this bird is played on top of a horizontal one (e.g., \textbf{Common Blackbird}), it is also placed horizontally and occupies both columns.
If a bird (e.g., \textbf{Common Buzzard}) is played on top of this one, the top bird is also placed horizontally and occupies both columns.
If a bird (e.g., \textbf{Common Buzzard}) is played on top of this one, the top bird is also placed horizontally and occupies both columns.
If a bird (e.g., \textbf{Common Buzzard}) is played on top of this one, the top bird is also placed horizontally and occupies both columns.
If this bird is played on top of a horizontal one (e.g., \textbf{Common Blackbird}), it is also placed horizontally and occupies both columns.
If this bird is played on top of a horizontal one (e.g., \textbf{Common Blackbird}), it is also placed horizontally and occupies both columns.
Even when using this bird's power to play it on top of another bird, this bird may only be played in [grassland].
When using this bird's power, if all [die] in the birdfeeder show the same face you may reroll before taking food.

A player's score for this goal tile is the minimum of the counts of eggs in each of their habitats.
This bird's power activates another bird's brown power, and it may activate a bird's power regardless of whether that bird is to the left or right of this bird.
This bird's power activates another bird's brown power, and it may activate a bird's power regardless of whether that bird is to the left or right of this bird.

When using this bird's power, the additional bird must be played in the same habitat as this bird.

You may use a pink power during another player's turn after your last turn of the game.
If you use this bird's power to play another bird with a ``play a second bird'' power, you may then use the latter bird's power to play yet another bird.

When using this bird's power in a game against the Automa, draw 3 [card], keep 2 of them, and discard the other.
You may activate each ``once between turns'' power on a bird on your player mat once between each of your turns.
If you use this bird's power to lay 2 [egg], they must be laid on different [bowl]/[star] birds.
If you use this bird's power to lay 2 [egg], they must be laid on different [cavity]/[star] birds.
If you use this bird's power to lay 2 [egg], they must be laid on different [ground]/[star] birds.
This bird does not count toward the \textbf{Anatomist} bonus card.
You may only reroll dice when gaining food from the birdfeeder and not when gaining food from the supply.

The only keywords that qualify a bird to count toward this bonus card are those listed thereon and those in the relevant sections of the expansion rulebooks. Substrings of bird names that coincide with names of body parts do not count toward the bonus when not referring to body parts (e.g., the \textit{wing} in \textbf{Burrowing Owl}).
This bird does not count toward the \textbf{Photographer} bonus card.
This bird counts toward the \textbf{Photographer} bonus card.
This bird counts toward the \textbf{Photographer} bonus card.
This bird counts toward the \textbf{Photographer} bonus card.
This bird counts toward the \textbf{Photographer} bonus card.

You may perform an action even if it precludes you from performing an action required at the end of your turn (e.g., discarding a [card] from your hand at the end of a turn in which you activated the \textbf{Black Tern}'s power).
If you perform more than one action ``at the end of your turn'', you may perform those actions in any order.
This bird counts toward the \textbf{Photographer} bonus card.
This bird's power lets you take 1 food from the birdfeeder, as if [wild] were replaced by [die] in the power text.
This bird's power is brown despite its entry in the \textit{European Expansion} rulebook appendix.
A card in your hand with the power, ``This bird counts double toward the end-of-round goal, if it qualifies for the goal.'' (e.g., \textbf{Cetti's Warbler}), does not count toward end-of-round goals.
This bird counts toward the \textbf{Photographer} bonus card.

The only keywords that qualify a bird to count toward this bonus card are those listed thereon, those in the relevant sections of the expansion rulebooks (excluding \textit{honey} in the \textit{European Expansion} rulebook---see \textbf{Honey}), and \textit{violet}. (\textit{Violet} currently occurs only on the \textbf{Violet-Green Swallow}, which already contains another keyword for this bonus card.) Substrings of bird names that coincide with color names do not count toward this bonus when not referring to colors (e.g., the \textit{red} in \textbf{Barred Owl}), but see \textbf{Northern Bobwhite}.

The word \textit{violet} is a keyword for the \textbf{Photographer} bonus card. (This keyword currently occurs only on the \textbf{Violet-Green Swallow}, which already contains another keyword for \textbf{Photographer}.)
If you use this bird's power to play another bird with a teal power, you may resolve that power at any point among your other remaining teal powers.
If you use this bird's power to play another bird with a teal power, you may resolve that power at any point among your other remaining teal powers.
If you use this bird's power to play another bird with a teal power, you may resolve that power at any point among your other remaining teal powers.

When using this bird's power, draw the [card] from the bird tray before it is refilled.

Unless specifically stated, your actions are assumed only to affect your player mat, supply, etc. (For example, the \textbf{American Avocet}'s power may not be used to lay an [egg] on another player's bird.)
You may not use this bird's power to lay an [egg] on another player's bird.

A future printing of this card will have the [predator] symbol; for now, play the card as printed.
A future printing of this card will have the [flocking] symbol; for now, play the card as printed.
Food cached on this bird is ``used'' (for points) and hence does not count as unused food when breaking point ties while scoring.
Food cached on this bird is ``used'' (for points) and hence does not count as unused food when breaking point ties while scoring.
Since this power is brown, when activating it in a game against the Automa the Automa always has zero action cubes in its [wetland].
You may not use a pink power during your turn (when an opponent performs an action that would otherwise enable using such a power).
This bird counts double toward precisely the end-of-round bonuses that count birds, not those that count other quantities. When in your hand this card does not count toward end-of-round bonuses.
This bird counts double toward precisely the end-of-round bonuses that count birds, not those that count other quantities. When in your hand this card does not count toward end-of-round bonuses.
This bird counts double toward precisely the end-of-round bonuses that count birds, not those that count other quantities. When in your hand this card does not count toward end-of-round bonuses.
In games where the Automa has drawn this bonus card, the Automa selects birds that have tucking powers; these powers are precisely those which contain the word `tuck' or `tucked'.
On this bonus card `name' refers only to the common name, not the scientific name.
On this bonus card `name' refers only to the common name, not the scientific name.
On this bonus card `name' refers only to the common name, not the scientific name.
Cards whose powers include the phrase ``it becomes a tucked card'' (e.g., \textbf{Common Buzzard}) qualify for the \textbf{Citizen Scientist} bonus card when the Automa has drawn it.
In games where the Automa has drawn the \textbf{Citizen Scientist} bonus card, this bird qualifies for that bonus card.
In games where the Automa has drawn the \textbf{Citizen Scientist} bonus card, this bird qualifies for that bonus card.

In games where the Automa has drawn the \textbf{Citizen Scientist} bonus card, this bird qualifies for that bonus card.

If a pink power is triggered by a player using the ``gain food'', ``lay eggs'', or ``draw bird cards'' action, the pink power is resolved after the player collects the resources indicated on the player mat but before any brown powers in the corresponding row are activated. If a pink power is triggered by another bird's power, the pink power is resolved after the other bird's power has been resolved.
Whenever you are entitled to gain resources, you may choose to take some but not all of the quantity specified.
A bird with a [flocking] power qualifies for this bonus card regardless of the color of that power despite the specification of brown powers in this bonus card's entry in the Appendix.
A bird with a [predator] power qualifies for this bonus card regardless of the color of that power despite the specification of brown powers in this bonus card's entry in the Appendix.

If you use a bird's power to play in the same habitat a bird an alternative food cost specified via an asterisk next to its food cost, you may pay the alternative cost (which thus counts as paying the bird's ``normal food cost'') instead of paying its food cost.
When using this bird's power, you may take the drawn cards from the deck and/or from the bird tray, despite this bird's entry in the Appendix.
``Trading'' counts as ``spending''.
``Trading'' counts as ``spending''.

If information printed on a card conflicts with the card's appendix entry, the information on the card takes precedence. (See \textbf{American Oystercatcher}, \textbf{Belted Kingfisher}, and \textbf{Eastern Kingbird}.)

This bird's power is triggered by another player playing a bird in their [wetland] during their turn, even when not using the ``play a bird'' card action to do so (instead using, e.g., the \textbf{Common Moorhen}'s power), despite this bird's entry in the Appendix.

Using this bird's power to play a bird in your [wetland] triggers the power of the \textbf{Belted Kingfisher} on another player's player mat, despite the \textbf{Belted Kingfisher}'s entry in the Appendix.

This bird's power is triggered by another player playing a bird in their [forest] during their turn, even when not using the ``play a bird'' card action to do so (instead using, e.g., the \textbf{Goldcrest}'s power), despite this bird's entry in the Appendix.

Using this bird's power to play a bird in your [forest] triggers the power of the \textbf{Eastern Kingbird} on another player's player mat, despite the \textbf{Eastern Kingbird}'s entry in the Appendix.

Using this bird's power to play a bird in your [forest] triggers the power of the \textbf{Eastern Kingbird} on another player's player mat, despite the \textbf{Eastern Kingbird}'s entry in the Appendix.
You may substitute 2 [wild] for any 1 food in a bird's food cost whenever you play a bird, including outside the scope of the ``play a bird'' action.
You may not use this bird's power to trade a food token for a food token of the same type.
Cards discarded to the discard pile are placed face up.
Players may look through the discard pile at any time.
As of the release of the Oceania Expansion, \textit{honey} is no longer a keyword for the \textbf{Photographer} bonus card.
As of the release of the Oceania Expansion, \textit{honey} is no longer a keyword for the \textbf{Photographer} bonus card, and hence this bird no longer qualifies for it.

When using this bird's power, you must draw all X+1 cards as instructed, since some of them are allocated to other players.
This bird counts toward the \textbf{Photographer} bonus card.
When using this bird's power, you must gain all [seed] available in the birdfeeder, since some of it may be allocated to other players.
When using this bird's power to discard another bird from your mat, all food cached on that bird, [egg] laid on that bird, and [card] tucked under that bird are discarded.
When scoring the Site Selection Expert bonus card, this bird's [star] nest can count as different nest types in the two columns in which it was played.

When scoring this bonus card, birds played sideways can count toward a nest type in both of the columns in which they were played. A [star] nest on a sideways bird can count as different nest types in the two columns in which it was played.
When playing with the Oceania Expansion, follow the order of steps on the (Oceania Expansion) End of Round Reference, not the order given in the Oceania Expansion rulebook.
When playing with the Oceania Expansion, follow the order of steps on the (Oceania Expansion) End of Round Reference, not the order given in the Oceania Expansion rulebook.

If you use this bird's power to copy the power of a bird that lets it move to another habitat---and this bird satisfies applicable conditions, e.g., being the rightmost bird in its habitat---this bird may move to that habitat, even one in which in cannot be played.

If you use this bird's power to copy the power of a bird that lets it move to another habitat---and this bird satisfies applicable conditions, e.g., being the rightmost bird in its habitat---this bird may move to that habitat, even one in which in cannot be played.
``Discarding'' counts as ``spending''.
This bonus card only awards points for a single sequence of bird cards of increasing or decreasing wingspan.
This bonus card only awards points for a single sequence of bird cards of increasing or decreasing wingspan.
This bonus card only awards points for a single sequence of bird cards of increasing or decreasing wingspan.
``Ability'' is a synonym of ``power''.
